Reverting possible vandalism by [[Special:Contributions/64.213.223.83]] to version by The Elfoid. If this is a mistake, [[User:ClueBot/FalsePositives|report it]]. Thanks, [[User:ClueBot|ClueBot]]. (40868) (Bot)
/* Influence on culture, music, and business */
/* Influence on culture, music, and business */

That doesn't exactly mean pop rock. Lots of hard rock and heavy metal bands have used aspects of pop music. Could you provide a valid source that says they're pop rock, not "pop/rock." It's too broad.
repair formatting as per [[Template:Infobox musical artist]]
Pop rock is rock for a mainstream audience that has aspects of then-pop music - VH used pop drum sounds and synths.
There's no reference for pop rock. And the old reference said Van Halen was "pop/rock", which could mean pop or rock. It's a way to group music. It doesn't describe Van Halen's genre well at all.
